page.title: 01PORTHMADOG INTRODUCTION
page.content: Located at the NE corner of Cardigan Bay,the area includes most of the town of{Porthmadog,}the village of {Borth-y-Gest}and most of{Minffordd.} Nearly half the area consists of the wide sandy estuaries of the rivers Dwyryd & Glaslyn, and much of the rest is low-lying wetland recovered from the sea by the Cob, a stone embankment spanning the Glaslyn estuary.It carries the main road through the area,still subject to a toll,and the Festiniog Railway.Except for a few farms,virtually all development in the area post-dates the building of the Cob and Porthmadog harbour in the early 19th century. Porthmadog is now the commercial and shopping centre of a wide thinly- populated area;tourism is its main industry,its harbour used only by pleasure boats.
